company.schedule

Class Scheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • company.schedule.Scheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class Scheduler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    Represents the scheduler of the company. Contains a list of pending and finished orders, a set of assemblylines and the algorithms for scheduling the pending orders.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Scheduler(java.util.Set<Assemblyline> assemblylines)
      creates new schedule with the given set of assemblylines and empty lists of pending and finished orders.
      Scheduler(java.util.Set<Assemblyline> assemblylines, java.util.List<Order> pending, java.util.List<Order> finished)
      Creates a new schedule with the given initial details.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scheduler

        public Scheduler(java.util.Set<Assemblyline> assemblylines)
        creates new schedule with the given set of assemblylines and empty lists of pending and finished orders. The schedule uses the FIFO scheduling algorithm.

      • Scheduler

        public Scheduler(java.util.Set<Assemblyline> assemblylines,
         java.util.List<Order> pending,
         java.util.List<Order> finished)
        Creates a new schedule with the given initial details. The scheduler will initially use the FIFO algorithm.
        Parameters:
        assemblylines - The assemblylines this scheduler will control.
        pending - The initial list of pending orders. The order of this list will be kept.
        finished - The initial list of finished orders.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable obs,
          java.lang.Object obj)
        notifies this scheduler that one of his assemblylines has changed. This method handles the changes.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        obs - the assemblyline that notified this schedule. this parameter will be ignored though.
        obj - this parameter will be ignored.

      • placeOrder

        public void placeOrder(Order order)
        adds given order to the list of pending orders.

      • getPendingOrders

        public java.util.List<Order> getPendingOrders()
        Returns:
        All pending orders, in the order they were placed.

      • getFinishedOrders

        public java.util.List<Order> getFinishedOrders()
        Returns:
        All finished orders, in the order they were completed.

      • getCurrentAlgorithm

        public SchedulingAlgorithm getCurrentAlgorithm()
        Returns:
        the currently used scheduling algorithm.

      • setAlgorithm

        public void setAlgorithm(SchedulingAlgorithm algorithm)
        sets the scheduling algorithm to the given algorithm.

      • getETA

        public Timestamp getETA(Order order)
        Returns:
        estimated completion time of the given order, or null if the given order is not present in the list of pending orders of this schedule.

      • isOutOfOrders

        public boolean isOutOfOrders()
        Returns:
        true if there are no pending orders.

      • getDay

        public int getDay()
        Returns:
        the current day

      • getAssemblyLines

        public java.util.Set<Assemblyline> getAssemblyLines()
        Returns:
        the assembly lines
